beers.name: Pils
beers.description: Hopewell Pils is a crystal clear, hop-forward Pilsner inspired by the Northern German brewing tradition. Lightly bready malt is met with the floral zip of classic German noble hops, followed by a crispy clean, drying finish. A very precious Pilsner for very precious people.

beers.name: Tankbeer
beers.description: Tankbeer is an unfiltered, naturally carbonated Lager inspired by the rich traditions of Czech Republic bar culture. With notes of fresh dough, fragrant noble hop spice and a pleasantly pillowy body, this beer transports you to the brewer's cellar, where the beer is always fresh.

beers.name: Ride or Die
beers.description: A Pale Ale you can depend on — a bona fide fridge staple. Bright neon flavors of grapefruit and pine give way to a pleasantly soft malt base and a quick slice of balancing bitterness. Reliably tasty without a fuss.

beers.name: Going Places
beers.description: An IPA for those on the up-and-up. A vibrant combo of new-wave hops offers fresh citrus, tropical fruit and sticky pine with a prickly finish, putting this hoppy bev on the path ahead. Let's get it.

beers.name: Lightbeam
beers.description: A Hazy IPA that radiates the full spectrum of modern hop eccentricities. An initial burst swells with the essence of ripe mango, papaya and apricot, while reverberant threads of green grass and prickly pine tether its final form. Here's to a bright spot.

beers.name: Outside Voice
beers.description: An Extra Pale Ale (XPA) fashioned for warm, sunny days and the cookouts that coincide. Notes of dank tropical fruit lead the way, followed by an undercurrent of citrus zest and piney bitterness.

beers.name: Plain English
beers.description: A malty yet sessionable Brown Ale modeled after the traditional examples found in London and the southern half of England at large. Notes of toffee, caramel and light chocolate fill out this full-bodied brew, but its low ABV and dry finish make it an everyday drinker.

beers.name: Shaker
beers.description: A hopped up amber ale that conjures the classics of the ​'90s brewpub boom. Hopped thoroughly with tried-and-true varieties that dominated the era, bringing notes ofpine sap, grapefruit, fresh grass and resin. This one's forthe old heads.

beers.name: Soup
beers.description: A complex, red-hued Belgian ale with notes of gingersnap, clove, light toffee and banana.

beers.name: Olde Duck
beers.description: An English-style Barleywine aged 18 months in third use Bourbon barrels that previously held Deluxe Imperial Stout, and Heaven Hill before that. Rich and malty with notes of toffee, caramel, raisin, vanilla and light oak.
